thread.title: Wal-Mart to Stop Selling Semiautomatic Rifles, Citing Declining Demand
thread.title_full: Wal-Mart to Stop Selling Semiautomatic Rifles, Citing Declining Demand

title: Wal-Mart to Stop Selling Semiautomatic Rifles, Citing Declining Demand
text:
Paul.Ziobro@wsj.com Updated Aug. 26, 2015 3:50 p.m. ET 
Wal-Mart Stores Inc. will soon stop selling semiautomatic rifles, removing what have become politicized items from shelves for reasons the retailer says are purely business. 
Wal-Mart, the nationâ€™s biggest seller of guns and ammunition, will eliminate AR-15s and other similar rifles, spokesman Kory Lundberg said Wednesday. Instead, the retailer will carry more shotguns and other hunting weapons. Mr. Lundberg said the decision was... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
